data.event: On March 24, 1791, a bridge was built that gave the neighborhood an important strategic value during the British invasions of the RÃ­o de la Plata.

event.title: 1858, part of this bridge was destroyed

data.event: In 1858, part of this bridge was destroyed by flood and was replaced by a new iron bridge in 1871.

event.title: was replaced by a new iron bridge in 1871

data.event: In 1858, part of this bridge was destroyed by flood and was replaced by a new iron bridge in 1871.
There were a series of problems with this new bridge until the inauguration of its replacement in 1931 that still stands today.
There were a series of problems with this new bridge until the inauguration of its replacement in 1931 that still stands today.

However, an 1871 yellow fever epidemic that swept through many southern parts of the city forced most wealthy families and the area's middle class to relocate to the north of the city, leaving the neighbourhood to become the working-class area that it remains today.
